subject: Re: [junit] Inherit from Junit 4 while using its Annotations
msgSnippet: Hello Kai, ... Yes, you re not supposed to use anything from the old junit.* package in JUnit 4. Instead, do a static import for org.junit.Assert.* . Lasse --
messageBody:
Hello Kai,

On 8/14/07, kai.wiemer <k_aexon@...> wrote:
> Hi, i'm using junit (and jwebunit) for testing a webapplication. In
> the testframework i have serveral testcases (seperate classes) of
> which evereyone inherits from another class. furthermore it is
> nessecary that this class inherits from the junit-TestCase class. I am
> using annotations in the test classes.
> [...]
> Via google I found some examples that also used junit 4 and used the
> assert methods in the static way (i.e. TestCase.assertTrue(...)). Is
> this the way its meant to be used? :)

Yes, you're not supposed to use anything from the old junit.* package
in JUnit 4. Instead, do a static import for "org.junit.Assert.*".

Lasse
